channel.title: Sound stops working after emergency shutdown
channel.description:
For some reason, when I use gnome and xfce and play a full screen game, and then the game crashes so I hold down the power button and start it back up, then it asks me if I want to use english as a default language for all sessions, I press yes, then I login and my sound isn't working. It says my sound is on and stuff but I don't hear anything at all... Is there a fix for this?
Here is this thing about my sound: http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=a3ab57fb6280dfa40f70218ef34f7b7f58ff54a1

item.title: Sound stops working after emergency shutdown
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You shouldn’t lose sound forever. Did you try restarting alsa or something? Try other things if it happens again, reformatting isn’t the answer.

Yeah I tried everything, I had to reformat to fix it. But I decided to just use CTRL+ALT+Backspace next time I freeze instead of holding the power button down and losing sound forever.
